abstract: New York City Department relies on Robert Weston to provide them with decoys who accompany a suspect in police lineups, which are under legal scrutiny across the nation; recent studies suggest that mistaken identifications in lineups are leading cause of wrongful convictions, and that witnesses can be steered toward selecting the suspect who was arrested by the police.
snippet: The decoys in police lineups are often drawn from homeless shelters and street corners, but in the Bronx, one man plays the role of casting director for detectives.
